intro: Isotrema grande, commonly known as the large isotrema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
